response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: int[] n = new int[x.size()];
for(int i = 0; i < x.size(); i++){
    n[i] = x.get(i);
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can't convert an ArrayList to an int array. You can convert an ArrayList to an int array using Arrays.copyOf(x.toArray(new Integer[x.size()]), x.size());
Question: How to convert an ArrayList containing Integers to primitive int array?: :I'm trying to convert an ArrayList containing Integer objects to primitive int[] with the following piece of code, but it is throwing compile time error. Is it possible to convert in Java?List<Integer> x =  new ArrayList<Integer>();int[] n = (int[])x.toArray(int[x.size()]);
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
